attributes.action: End the new flight restrictions on passengers travelling from Northern Cyprus
attributes.background: In light of recent security policies in the USA, the UK has followed suit by insisting that passengers in transit from Ercan airport to Stansted (or U.K.) undertake extensive additional security checks at Istanbul airport.
attributes.additional_details:
Many passengers have been flying to London via a touch-down in Turkey for over 40 years without incident. Therefore This is perceived as a political decision. It has nothing to do with security. Ercan is one of the safest airports in the world.

This situation impacts the elderly and disabled, driving passengers south to Larnaca or Paphos airports.

We urge the UK government to reverse this policy immediately.

attributes.action: Make it law for all UK citizens to carry a identity card.
attributes.background: Carrying identity cards would help to prevent non UK residents using our NHS without paying for the service, and also stop people getting benefits when they are not entitled.

attributes.action: Make ear piercing in under 10s illegal.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that no child should be forced to have holes punctured in to their skin until they are old enough to understand what is involved.
attributes.additional_details: If you made a hole like that in any other part of a baby/child, you would have them taken away. Just because it has a gem in it, it's different? People say “It's better to get them done when they're little because they don't remember it”... It's not compulsory.

attributes.action: Ban the use of mobile phones in the House of Commons
attributes.background: Our MPs should have their full attention on the issues facing our country. You wouldn't be able to sit on your phone when you should be working at any other job, so why should they!

attributes.action: Privatise the BBC as we did with other public services
attributes.background: Can we trust the BBC? Is it impartial? Does it have a political agenda? How does it spend the billions of pounds it receives in tax payers money? Why does the BBC exist?
attributes.additional_details: It is an unaccountable tax payer funded organisation. Admittedly it makes some good programs, but give anyone a couple of billion pounds and its likely they'll make a good program. What is the BBC's overseas policy? WHO actually does the BBC answer to?

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction.
attributes.additional_details:
OBJECTIVE
-Licenced retail outlets allowed to sell knives and blades.
-Knives and blades to have concealed & tamper proof serial number.
-Registration of knives & blades via Metropolitan Police Website including Lost & Stolen.
-Photo ID, Proof of Address shown at point of sale. 
-CCTV installation means cases of identity fraud can be traced.
-Knives & Blades sold in sealed boxes - Not shelf sales.
-Ban on websites selling knives into the UK meaning a closed domestic market to Knife & Blade sales

attributes.action: UK Govt: Help to rebuild communities affected by the mudslides in Sierra Leone
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, recognise the immediate aid provided to Sierra Leone by the UK Government in the aftermath of the horrific mudslides. We ask the Government to continue to support Sierra Leone and to set out a long term strategy to help rebuild communities destroyed by the mudslides.

attributes.action: NHS need to invest more money in Adult Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals
attributes.additional_details: The NHS do not provide adequate staff and there are very few things to do on Adult Psychiatric wards. Staff need to be trained properly to deal with situations they do not know how to. There needs to be more distractions and activities to do and more staffing to ensure there are people to talk to when needed.

attributes.action: Halt the scrapping of HMS OCEAN.
attributes.background: HMS Ocean is a very versatile and potent warship which this country needs to keep in service (or build a replacement). Its value is not only as an assault ship but as a humanitarian support vessel.

attributes.action: Ban betting adverts on all TV channels before watershed
attributes.background: Gambling and betting are now well known addictions that are damaging to health, way of life, and destroy relationships and families.

attributes.action: Ban protesters from wearing facial coverings during demonstrations.
attributes.background: With the rise of Antifa, Right / Left wing demonstrations and violence, the hiding of faces to thwart identification of those who have committed criminal offences has become very prevalent it is a hinderance to later detection and a detriment to security.

attributes.action: Reduce Dartford crossing charges
attributes.background: Residents from Dartford and Thurrock  pay much reduced dart charge .  But people working on other side of the bridge pay a normal rate and even though you set yourself an online account - they still rip you off ! I spend ~£70 a month! Let's end this !

attributes.action: Mandatory for ALL eye tests to include Pupillary Distance (PD).
attributes.background: Without the Pupillary Distance (PD) it is impossible to create prescription glasses, get the distance wrong and depending on how inaccurate it is, can cause the following symptoms: blurry vision, double vision images, headaches, nausea, and fatigue.
attributes.additional_details:
- 69% of the UK population wear prescription glasses
- Online retailers can be 40% cheaper than high street opticians
- It is unfair that people on lower incomes are forced to buy cheap     glasses when they could afford fashionable frames and lens if they could buy from online retailers.
- Opticians don't provide PD today pointing to Statutory Instrument (1984 No. 1778). This was last reviewed in ’84 the internet was just for email then!! So this badly needs an update.

attributes.action: Place stoma signs on disabled toilets and add stoma changing facilities within.
attributes.background: Stoma patients have unseen disabilities and although entitled to use disabled toilets, often face verbal abuse from the public when trying to access them. Stoma patients need a hygienic area to change ostomies and this is not provided. Unseen stoma disabilities need protection and recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Stoma patients face prejudice from both the able and visibly disabled communities. Stoma patients are forcibly pushed and pulled out of the way when trying to access disabled facilities. 21,000 people are left with a stoma every year, this is a growing issue.

attributes.action: Debate the competence of the Prime Minister
attributes.background: The recent Florence speech by the Prime Minister has not fulfilled or satisfied the democratic outcome on membership of the EU membership referendum.  The wishes of the majority vote are not being supported by the Government.
attributes.additional_details: Given the history of other referendums concerning the EU, there is suspicion that delaying cpmplete separation from the EU, will in effect generate apathy in the electorate and result fudge and further compromise, even another referendum to keep UK in the EU. This completely contradicts the wishes of the majority who voted to leave.  The consequences of Government prevarication on this matter, will dilute and further diminish the right of the the Government to govern the governed. We the people, have no trust or confidence, in the competence of Theresa May to govern the UK satisfactorily.

attributes.action: Stop speed-limited vehicles from overtaking during peak congestion periods
attributes.background: Speed-limited vehicles performing over-taking manoeuvres cause congestion on motorways and dual carriageways during peak periods. Such manoeuvres are slow in terms of time and distance and create bottle necks. Limiting these to outside of peak periods would ease congestion.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: Change the law, employers to offer 48hr rest periods per week to night workers
attributes.background: Working nights comes with its heightened health risks. Obesity, diabetes, heart disease, lower life expectancy etc. Jet lag is certain. Working nights disorientated, whether it's physically demanding or operating machinery is a risk to health and safety. Please keep night workers healthy and safe
attributes.additional_details: Evidence has shown that a change in ones body clock affects the immune system and metabolism. When there is only a rest period of 24 hours in a week, most night workers will work a shift until 6-9am and try to readjust their body clock to suit their day off work. When there is only a 24 hour period off work this has a severe detrimental effect on ones immune system and health. Many have commonly become disoriented, tired and even ill. This is dangerous.

attributes.action: Set the National living wage for all who work not just 25
attributes.background: Help more people into work and a fair pay living wage

attributes.action: UK Government to impose trade sanctions on Venezuela, over human rights abuses.
attributes.background: Democracy has been betrayed in Venezuela. With top opposition politicians like: Leopoldo Lopez and Antonio Ledezma, being unlawfully arrested. The severity of the political crisis has triggered mass protests for months. Protests resulting in: nearly 5000 arrests; 163 deaths; 15,000 injured.
attributes.additional_details: Why should the UK Government fund a tyrannical state? A state that ignores International Human Rights Agreements, that they even co-signed. A state where the detention of the opposition is natural. In 2015, Venezuela exported $286 million worth of goods to the UK - most of which was mineral products (99.2%). The UK exports to Venezuela in 2015 amounted a total of $318 million. Although Venezuela may be an attractive source of investment for UK firms, I urge them to stop. Simply because the trade revenue enables Pres Maduro's suppression of basic human rights. The UK should impose embargo on the nation until democracy has been restored.

attributes.action: Make March 29th Brexit Bank Holiday
attributes.background: Celebrate our EU exit

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Change the law for unmarried couples concerning benefits when a partner dies.
attributes.background: My partner of 26 years recently died. Although we were treated as a married couple for benefits whilst he was alive as soon as he died our time together did not count any more. I couldn't register his death and am not entitled to any of the benefits widows get.
attributes.additional_details: It is not right  that you are classed as a couple in life but single after a death. The law needs to be changed so that couples who have been together for a certain number of years, especially when claiming benefits together, can be treated the same as a married couple. My grief has been worsened by constantly being told if you don't have the piece of paper you can't register his death or claim any help, as a widow/widower could, for example help with funeral costs.

attributes.action: Increase Fines and Points for Using a Mobile Phone while Driving
attributes.background: As it has been Proven today’s Fine and Points are Not Working, the Police have said so, we can Still see Drivers using them each time we go out, seeing this Kills as Proven the Law needs to be much stronger, we have nearly been hit by a lorry being steered by one hand and coming over our side.
attributes.additional_details: These Drivers have not Learned anything by the last increase, White Vans seem to be the Worst offenders, Lives must be Protected on our roads from their actions, it may be a good idea to Increase the Points so that they could loose their Jobs to make them think, it’s No good after the fact where others are Injured or Killed, let’s Stop the Idiots that ignore the Laws.

attributes.action: Enforce all dog groomers must be qualified & registered under a regulating body.
attributes.background: I have recently had a terrible experience with a dog groomer,when investigating who I needed to report her too I realised that there is no one! no qualifications are needed and no regulating body to be accountable to. Please sign this petition,  together we can make a difference for our dogs.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to the animal welfare who told me there is nothing anyone could do and the rspca wouldn't be interested! My dog is a teddy bear looking Lhasapoo with gorgeous teddy bear paws sadly he has now  been completely shaven, almost to the skin,she has even cut him on his chest and he has lost his whiskers.he was terrified when I picked him up. We really need the law to be changed and for all dog groomers to be qualified and accountable to a regulating body so this can not happen again to others.

attributes.action: Change the GCSE English Literature exam from closed book to open book.
attributes.background: Last year, lots of students struggled with GCSE English Literature as it was a closed book exam. Because of this many failed. How can they expect us to remember quotes from 15 poems, plus how to analyse them, plus remembering the whole plot, themes, characters and quotes from another book.
attributes.additional_details: Is it really fair that students have to remember so much, whilst also doing revision for other exams. It is important to know how to do all that is asked in the exams, but when in life will you ever have to remember lots of information about lots of texts, then be expected to recall it perfectly under pressured conditions, on top of loads of other stresses, then write about it for strangers to judge whether or not you are worthy of a good grade or not.

attributes.action: Give children a choice of water or squash with school dinners
attributes.background: Not all children like water, I myself as an adult don't like it either. So why should a child as young as 4 be made to go all day without a drink because it's the only drink offered with school meals. My daughter being a 4 year old i think it's unfair.

attributes.action: Get rid of all school uniforms
attributes.background: I personally find most school uniforms ridiculously uncomfortable and believe that we, as students, should be able to wear anything we like to school within reason. I also believe that if anyone should go to school in a uniform, it should be the teachers.

attributes.action: Outlaw the sale of new build properties as buy-to-let "investments"
attributes.background:
Too many new-build properties are sold as buy-to-let "investments", often at first refusal before they are even complete.  This restricts supply, keeps prices inflated, and usually keeps young people off the property ladder and in the trap of high private rents.

This should be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing an unprecedented housing crisis in terms of supply, cost, and the extremely high private rents.  Young people are trapped for YEARS as tenants, or living with parents, because there are precious few affordable homes in many places.

There are whole new-build housing estates and blocks of flats which are sold off in advance (often before the property is even built) and become 100% BTL empires from the very first day, not available for people to actually buy for themselves.

attributes.action: Allow Walid Durani to stay permanently in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2012 Walid fled Afghanistan to the UK after his Grandfather was beheaded.  Walid was threatened with the same fate.  Since then he has been educated and completed an apprenticeship here. He was Highly Commended at the Youth Build UK awards that took place in Parliament in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
At the age of 18 the UK Government said he should be sent back to Kabul, Afghanistan. Walid has no family or support in Afghanistan and his life will certainly be danger. Kabul is an extremely dangerous place with the Foreign Office currently advising against all but essential travel & in some areas they advise against all travel.
His story has been covered by the BBC,various radio stations & newspapers.
Please help us support Walid by signing this petition. Follow us on facebook - Support Walid

attributes.action: Make Cyclists have a Bell or some Warning device fitted.
attributes.background: Due to the amount of Cyclists killing or Injuring people on Foot it makes sense to be able to Warn others. A new Bike is required to have a Bell when Purchased but then you can remove it, on the Highways and Public open spaces like Hills and Commons it Must be Law
attributes.additional_details:
A number of Cyclists these days take and do dangerous practices as seen, like going through Red lights or going around them on the Path, Riding on the Footpaths, plus a number more.

Let’s start with the Warning Device.

attributes.action: Require schools to teach year five and above about LGBT and how it’s positive.
attributes.background: It is important that children know about gay and transgender people as someone they know could be gay/trans or some might be gay/trans themselves.
attributes.additional_details: I got lots of abuse when I came out as gay because the people I was around did not know much on the subject. I also know many people who experienced this kind of abuse.

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.

attributes.action: Provide blood glucose meters for all type 2 diabetics on the NHS
attributes.background: You can't control blood sugar levels without knowing what affects your blood sugar and it's too expensive to buy your own meter and strips as well.

attributes.action: Change trespassing from a civil offence to a criminal offence.
attributes.background: More and more trespassing and trespassers are exempt from any direct police action. What follows are costly legal proceedings against trespassers to eventually evict and in some cases the trespassers return to start the whole eviction process again.
attributes.additional_details: http://dailym.ai/2h40DL0

attributes.action: Magazines legally required to disclose when models have been photoshopped.
attributes.background:
1.6 million people in the UK suffer from eating disorders. I believe some of this comes from the high pressure placed on women and men to be thin and toned.
One main source of this is because of the beauty standards upheld in our magazines. Women and men are photo shopped into the "perfect" figure.
attributes.additional_details:
There is such a high pressure on people to fit into the mould that is projected through magazines. This mould for women is thin, toned, bid breasts, big bum and perfect skin. For men the mould is lean and muscly, six-pack and a large package. 

Pictures in magazines cannot be something people aspire to be because they aren't real body expectation. 

France has already introduced this law to help defeat eating disorders and promote a healthy body image, I believe we should too.

attributes.action: No Clock Changes: Maintain British Summer Time through the year
attributes.background: Changing clocks twice a year is a stupid, inefficient and outdated practice.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland could have its own separate time if it needs to.

attributes.action: Christmas items must not be advertised, stocked or displayed before December
attributes.background: It should be law for any businesses not to advertise, stock or sell any Christmas related items
attributes.additional_details: It is currently September and we can see Christmas items before Halloween items or Firework items

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background:
The House of Lords is meant to be a revising chamber for Government legislation. It is currently bursting at the seams with unelected peers who claim expenses and do not vote. 115 peers claimed £1.3m in expenses but scarcely uttered a word or voted.
Replace the House with an elected upper chamber.
attributes.additional_details:
It is time for elections to the House of Lords.
Elect people from different backgrounds and experience to represent the people and truly hold Parliament to account.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are the main reason huge tracts of rainforest are destroyed every day, releasing huge amounts of carbon into the atmosphere. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Refined palm oil also contains large amounts of harmful fatty acid esters, known to cause cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil#start

http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/ng-interactive/2014/nov/10/palm-oil-rainforest-cupboard-interactive

http://www.rainforestfoundationuk.org/palmoil

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Cancel the £10bn for Help-to-Buy; give it to councils and allow them to build.
attributes.background: Theresa May has today pledged £10bn (unfunded) for Help-to-Buy. This will increase housing demand, not supply, adding further to the unaffordable property bubble. It ignores the systemic issues in Britain’s housing sector and will likely help those that need it least.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the government to, instead, use this £10bn to build truly affordable homes and address the fundamental issues in Britain’s provision of housing.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: More and More Drivers are using the Footpaths to Park on, this causes a number of issue such as No consideration for the Disabled/Blind and Pushchairs where Children could run into the road, plus Damage being caused to the Footpaths due to them Not being made for Vehicles costing Money to repair.
attributes.additional_details: Very often people on Foot with Pushchairs and Disabled Scooters can Not get through which causes a Safety issue with people having to go out into the road with children in some cases, Footpaths as in the name are for people on Foot and Disabled Scooters, the Councils have to pay good Money in Repairs where they are not re enforced, this come go elsewhere to needed causes, many Drivers are just Lazy these days, London should Not be the Only place that Banned them, Not Equal and Wrong.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Convicted terrorists should be jailed in special prisons for whole of life
attributes.background: Terrorists aim to kill. When they have been caught and prosecuted they should never have another opportunity to kill. They spread their ideology in prison increasing risk to public when they and others are released. They must be held in special prisons and kept there until they die.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.
